Text:
Nearly half of Americans do not earn enough to afford to rent a one bedroom apartment.
Half our people continue to live paycheck to paycheck.

Meanwhile, Elon Musk is some $293 BILLION richer since the start of the pandemic.

That's what a rigged economy is all about.

What do the American people want? ASK THEM! They've told us loud and clear, again and again.

Lower RX drug costs. 88% support!
Expand Medicare to cover dental, vision, & hearing. 84% support!
Paid family & medical leave. 73% support!

Here's a radical idea: listen to the people.

It's a new day, and it's the same story. The polls are telling us what you and I already know to be true: the American people overwhelmingly support the provisions of the Build Back Better Act.

Good policy. Good politics. Win/win! Now let's get it done. https://t.co/g1HNNM0ljn

Do I lose sleep at night worrying about what the wealthy and corporate CEOs think about the reconciliation bill? Honestly? No. Not at all. What I worry about is what our government is going to do to address the long-neglected needs of the working class.

The debate over prescription drug costs in this country is not a debate about innovation, or the best way to prevent illness. It is about whether we maintain a system which allows Big Pharma to profit at the American people's expense, or whether we take on their greed.

The ability to spend time with your newborn baby should not depend on where you work, your income, or your zip code. We must end the absurdity of being the only major country not to guarantee paid family and medical leave.

400 richest Americans' wealth in 1991: $288 billion

400 richest Americans' wealth today: $5.3 trillion

Americans unable to afford to fill their prescriptions today: 18,000,000

Who is our economy working for?

Who gives a damn what a handful of corporate donors want from Congress? I listen to the people — and here's what the people say:
88% want lower RX drug costs
84% want to expand Medicare to cover dental, vision, and hearing
73% want paid family and medical leave

Let's do it.

88% of the American people support our efforts to lower prescription drug costs — 88%!

Is it just me, or is that an overwhelming majority of this country?

I say we get this done.
https://t.co/1tbjDRmict

Interesting. Conservative Dems want to make sure that Build Back Better is fully paid for at exactly the same time that they voted for an infrastructure bill that, according to the CBO, increases the federal deficit by $256 billion.  Not very consistent!

Pop quiz. Take 1,500 pharmaceutical lobbyists up on Capitol Hill, add them together with 535 members of Congress — what do you get?

If you guessed 'the American people paying the highest prices on the planet for prescriptions,' you guessed right.

Let's end Big Pharma's greed.

The patent for insulin was sold for $1 so it would be available to all.

Insulin in the United States is now the 6th most expensive liquid in the world.

That is the power of Big Pharma's greed when it goes unchallenged. NOW is the time that we finally take them on.

Not one member of the GOP voted for the expanded Child Tax Credit.
Not one of you is prepared to support paid family and medical leave.

"Party of parents"? Give me a break. https://t.co/pQWEo4nWt8

From Big Pharma to John Deere to Kellogg's, there is a common thread: corporate greed. Under a system which is meant to create more and more wealth for fewer and fewer people, 'enough' will never be enough. We must build working class solidarity and end their greed.

Cost for one vial of insulin in 1996: $21
Cost for the same vial of insulin in 2018: $320

What possible reason, other than greed, could there be for the pharmaceutical industry to raise the price of insulin by more than 1,400%?

It's time to end Big Pharma's greed.
There is a war being waged by corporate America against the working class of this country — the working class is fighting back, and the working class is going to win that war. https://t.co/NRzk7xQDUm
Solidarity forever. https://t.co/1eYURwAP2U

What the labor movement is about is solidarity. It is people understanding that we can't do it alone. The only way we can win what we deserve as human beings is when we come together in unions. https://t.co/XIGL9PW27V

"If we understand that we have the power, we can change the dynamic here... If we say how it's going to go, if we say that you're not going to it done without us, then we can actually change the world." - @FlyingWithSara https://t.co/FORAslthE0

"After working 12 hours, whether you work days or nights, you can be told, 'we're short staffed, you have to work an additional 4.'" - Melissa Piechovicz, a nurse in New York discussing the forced overtime and short staffing epidemic https://t.co/2Td882PYQe
Workers at Kellogg's have been forced to work 7 days a week, 12 hours a day. How the hell are you expected to do that? https://t.co/CsV8z51Ujh

Do you know how much the pharmaceutical industry is spending to make it so they can continue charging you the highest prices on the planet for prescription drugs? $300 million on lobbying alone! Do you got that? https://t.co/twcnE1I9a6

"For the past 40 years, the typical American wage earner has no real wage raise whatsoever when adjusted for inflation... And we have not seen so much wealth concentrated at the top since the Gilded Age of the 1890's. " - @RBReich https://t.co/fEUw2sfMHG

"If you don't understand that there always has to be a struggle, that we always have to fight, then we're going to lose the muscle to fight, to fight for our democracy, and to fight for our children." - @FlyingWithSara https://t.co/pRxkgLC6bR

"When you look at it, this is all about worker exploitation. Throughout the pandemic, we were hailed as 'heroes'... 16 months later, the 'hero' is a zero. They don't want to acknowledge what we bring to the table." - Trevor Bidelman, a Kellogg's worker in Michigan https://t.co/6pC5S6cMpI

"John Deere has surpassed their record profit year. They're prepared to make between $5.7 and $5.9 billion in profits this year. They rewarded their CEO with a 160% salary increase. We've been asking for something fair and equitable." - Chris Laursen, a John Deere worker in Iowa https://t.co/bUMqonyCCc

LIVE: The power rests with those who get together, who organize, and who stand up for their rights. That's exactly what tens of thousands of workers all across this country are doing right now. Join our town hall meeting. https://t.co/owegcoLdxt
Caring for your eyes, your ears, and your teeth is health care. Period. Yes, we must expand Medicare to cover vision, hearing, and dental care. That is a no-brainer.

TONIGHT: Join me, @FlyingWithSara, @RBReich, and striking @UAW & @BCTGM workers for a town hall discussion on the recent uprising of workers on strike against exploitation on the job.

Tune in at https://t.co/vreIiWwPgq https://t.co/RLaSwfzbPr
That is beyond unacceptable. I will not support more tax breaks for billionaires. https://t.co/4t68Q8U3P5

Workers all over this country are standing up to demand decent pay and dignity on the job. That is the kind of action we need if we are to rebuild America's middle class.

Tomorrow night, join me, @FlyingWithSara, @RBReich, and striking workers for a town hall discussion. https://t.co/ufJZw4PgmB

When 41% of the American people tell us that their top priority is for us to expand Medicare to include dental and vision benefits — one of the most popular items in the Build Back Better agenda — what should we do?

We should listen to the people. Let's get this done. https://t.co/DFo5P4IMdD

At a time when half our people are living paycheck to paycheck, @PhilMurphyNJ raised the minimum wage to a living wage. That is exactly the leadership New Jersey needs. We must make sure he’s reelected tonight. NEW JERSEY: VOTE!

Find your polling place: https://t.co/SXb9r3AVhQ https://t.co/ifBmo3F1Tk

BUFFALO, NEW YORK: Today you have the opportunity to cast your ballot for @Indiawaltonbflo and her bold vision which invests in the needs of the people, not the moneyed interests. 

Polls are open now until 9:00 PM. VOTE! VOTE! VOTE! https://t.co/rPqa1ben9N

"If all workers would stand up, stand together — the exploitation of the worker in this country can stop."

I am proud to stand in strong solidarity with @BCTGM workers in their struggle for a fair contract and reasonable hours. https://t.co/2VI3PVa6JS

Right now, the pharmaceutical industry is doing everything they can to make sure that 1 out of 4 Americans continues to be unable to afford the prescriptions their doctors write. 

Does that sound acceptable to you at all? https://t.co/rY8BGvbg27

Think about this: the exact same medications, manufactured by the same companies, in the same factories are all available in Canada, Europe, Australia and Japan for a fraction of the price that the American people pay.

And why? Because of Big Pharma's greed. 

Time to end it.

Our health care system today says it's alright for drug manufacturers to increase the price of insulin by more than 300% in a decade.

How does that sit with you? Don't you think it's time Congress took on the greed of the pharmaceutical industry?
The neverending greed of the pharmaceutical industry is a threat to the economic security of working people all across this country and it must be stopped.

I stand in solidarity today with Politico and E&E News employees uniting together to demand a voice in the future of their workplace. Management should recognize the union and immediately begin good faith negotiations. https://t.co/yJd9L0IZlz

🇨🇦 Price of asthma inhaler Flovent Diskus: $27
🇺🇸 Price of asthma inhaler Flovent Diskus: $242

There is no rational reason — other than greed — for the pharmaceutical industry to charge the American people nearly 10x what the people of Canada pay for the exact same prescription.
Insulin in the United States should not cost 10x what it costs in Canada.

LIVE: Raising the minimum wage. Paid leave. Equal pay. The progress made under the leadership of Gov. Phil Murphy must be protected. Join us as we rally with the young people of New Jersey at Rutgers University. https://t.co/IXwlwkofyO
The business model of the pharmaceutical industry is greed.

You can walk into the pharmacy today for a refill of the exact same medicine you've used for 10 years, and the price could be DOUBLE what it was when you got your last refill. And there's nothing you can do about it — unless Congress summons the courage to end Big Pharma's greed.

What does the pharmaceutical industry do with the record-breaking profits they make year after year? Over the past 20 years, they have spent over $4.5 BILLION on lobbying. You got that? That's BILLIONS — with a 'B' — to guarantee they can continue to rip off the American people. https://t.co/K8ZFMYmugv

Does anybody seriously think it is 'radical' to suggest that the pharmaceutical industry should not be able to charge the American people FOUR TIMES as much as other major countries pay for the exact same prescription drugs?

How many people need to die, how many people need to get unnecessarily sicker, how many people will needlessly suffer before the Congress will summon the courage to finally take on the greed of the pharmaceutical industry?

Let me tell you what a dysfunctional health care system is all about. In our country today, nearly 1 out of every 4 Americans cannot afford the medications that their doctors prescribe. How insane is that?!
It is not the case anywhere else on the planet, but uniquely, here in America, the pharmaceutical industry can raise prices at any time they want, and to any price they want. UNACCEPTABLE!

Now is the time for Congress to finally have the courage to take on the pharmaceutical industry. They cannot continue to charge us the highest prices in the world for prescription drugs. https://t.co/fMzkYuQPaH

Why is it that the pharmaceutical industry is able to charge the American people the highest prices on the planet for prescription drugs? Because their greed goes unchallenged in Washington, D.C.

I say we put an end to that.

Join me tonight for a live address. https://t.co/abvRWYVJV7

Raising the minimum wage. Paid leave. Equal pay. This is the progress made under the leadership of @PhilMurphyNJ, and this Thursday, we'll rally to get out the vote at Rutgers University.

I hope you can join us. https://t.co/tFQ0kCT5ZZ

Days of paid leave offered to new moms around the world:
🇮🇪: 182
🇮🇹: 152
🇩🇰: 126
🇨🇦: 119
🇦🇹: 112
🇫🇷: 112
🇪🇸: 112
🇩🇪: 98
🇯🇵: 98
🇮🇸: 91
🇸🇪: 90
🇲🇽: 84
🇺🇸: 0

It's time we end that international embarrassment and finally guarantee paid family and medical leave in this country.

You know, I don't recall seeing Big Pharma and their lobbyists on the ballot in 2020, yet in Washington today, they are calling the shots. That has got to end.

The American people want us to lower prescription drug prices. I say we listen to the people and get it done.

Cost for one vial of Humalog insulin in 2009: $93
Cost for the same vial of insulin in 2021: $297

As long as the greed of the pharmaceutical industry continues to go unchecked, they can charge YOU, the American people, whatever price they want!

Enough. Time to end their greed.
Keeping teeth in your mouth as you grow old should not be a luxury in this country.

The expansion of Medicare to cover dental, hearing and vision is supported by 84% of the public and is one of the most important provisions in Build Back Better. It's what the American people want and, after waiting over 50 years, what they are going to get.
I don't know about my Republican colleagues, but I think it is outrageous that it is considered "normal" in this country for working class moms to be back at work within days of giving birth.
The most radical thing we can do in regards to the climate crisis is to continue to do nothing.

JOIN OUR PANEL: We are proposing historic legislation which says you know what? Maybe we should finally invest in the needs of working people. Join us for a special rebroadcast of our panel discussion, 'What's In The Damn Bill?.' https://t.co/cU35N2yCnJ

It is the workers who brought John Deere a year of record-breaking profits — not their CEO, not their executives — and it is workers who deserve a decent wage and a fair contract. https://t.co/UjfDD0aXzL

Voters in Arizona and across this country want us to take on the greed of the pharmaceutical industry and lower the cost of prescription drugs through Medicare negotiations.

Here's a radical idea: we listen to the people and get it done. https://t.co/Yz65b5QBCq

Let me let you in on a little secret: what we are trying to accomplish with the Build Back Better plan is not radical stuff! We are simply suggesting that maybe, just maybe, our government should invest in the long-neglected needs of working people. https://t.co/NdPPrGL3fk

Does it make any sense to you at all?

If you are a diabetic living in England, you're able to get a vial of insulin for around $7. But if you're a diabetic here in the United States, you pay $98 for the EXACT SAME insulin?

How crazy is that? We must end the greed of Big Pharma.
The average billionaire in America today has a lower tax rate than the average worker. Does that seem acceptable to you?

I want you all to take a guess. How many lobbyists do you think the pharmaceutical industry has up on Capitol Hill for the 535 members of Congress?

Ready for the answer? OVER 1,500. You want to know why we pay the highest prices on the planet for prescriptions? Start there.

Guess what? We are the only major country on the planet that doesn't guarantee a single day of paid family and medical leave. You have a baby in America today and you're low-income, you're back at work in a day or two. That is barbaric.

"I don't think anybody doesn't want to see John Deere make profits — we know that golden goose has to lay golden eggs. But man, it's time to share some of the gold."

I want you to take a moment and listen to what the John Deere workers on strike for a fair contract have to say. https://t.co/MBdjNJqmuk

Look, John Deere is not a poor company. They are currently on track to make some $5.7 BILLION in profits this year alone. Yes, they can absolutely afford to treat their workers with the dignity they deserve. John Deere must come to the table and negotiate a fair contract. https://t.co/JApYAk3M5Z

The worst fear in the world for the ruling class of this country is that people wake up one day and they say, 'I am a human being. And I and my children are entitled to live with dignity.' https://t.co/yspb8EfBqb
"The truly radical thing to do on climate would be to do nothing." - @VarshPrakash https://t.co/CpKBTi7Ry8

"A strong labor movement is going to be very critical from now until the rest of our lifetimes in securing a lot of these victories, not just legislatively, but with the tactic of withholding labor." - @AOC on the need for the worker protections in the Build Back Better plan https://t.co/78ZqUTVF2I

Brothers and sisters, what we are trying to do here is not radical. Much of what we're talking about exists today in other countries. This is us trying to finally do right by the American working class and finally having the courage to stand up to big money interests. https://t.co/AODmAl0Ptr

"[Corporate lobbyists] want YOU to give up before the deal is done, because it's way easier for them to try to get away with the things that they're lobbying for and against if people at home aren't watching." - @AOC on the need to stay engaged in the fight for this bill https://t.co/YaJTDFaORz

"The Build Back Better plan means that over the next few years, thousands of young people can get paid strong wages and gain work experience in doing the vital work to protect our planet and its people against the worst of the climate crisis." - @VarshPrakash https://t.co/GF6lFG8btq

"Blocking this bill... is economically insane... The lie of scarcity is literally sickening in this moment. We spent $21 trillion on war and militarization since 9/11. " - @RevDrBarber https://t.co/hHtRIIv55r

"What are the human consequences of the pharmaceutical industry's greed? 30% of Americans do not take the prescriptions that their doctors tell them to because they can't afford it." - @alaw202 on the need to finally allow Medicare to negotiate prescription drug prices https://t.co/PVx0VoGU61

"Investing in child care workers and home care workers means that families will finally get access to the care they need. It means that 96% of women that do this work will finally be paid a living wage and join together in a union." - @MaryKayHenry https://t.co/JMrP5KDqzp

This bill provides universal pre-K for 3- and 4-year-old kids all across this country and makes child care affordable to that no family pays more than 7% of their income on child care costs. That is no small thing. https://t.co/2opdhl7yXc

LIVE: We are working to pass the most consequential legislation for the working class in decades. Tune in NOW to find out how policies in the reconciliation bill will meet your needs and what we must do to get it done. https://t.co/ieSNmFJkrw

I find it absurd that while billionaires in this country have gotten 70% richer since the start of the pandemic, working families are living paycheck to paycheck, struggling to afford their prescriptions, struggling to afford childcare.

We must invest in the working class.

What is the worst that would happen if we showed working people that their government can deliver for them, and not just those at the top? It would show working people that DEMOCRACY WORKS! A democracy which delivers for its people, the worst nightmare of the ruling class.

TONIGHT: Polls show a majority of the American people support the policies in our reconciliation bill, but too many don't know they're actually in the bill! Tonight, @AOC, @RevDrBarber, @MaryKayHenry, @VarshPrakash, and @alaw202 join me to discuss. I hope you'll join us. https://t.co/t1rZXNt9wB
The company should instead come to the table and negotiate a fair contract.

John Deere's profits have exploded by some 67%, but workers who spent years with the company are now being forced off their insurance. That is beyond outrageous. John Deere is a hugely profitable company, and workers must be allowed to keep their health care during the strike.

TOMORROW: The corporate media has done a pretty poor job covering the reconciliation legislation, which has left a lot of working people asking, 'What's in the damn bill?'

Join me, @AOC, @RevDrBarber, @MaryKayHenry, @VarshPrakash, and @alaw202 tomorrow for a panel discussion. https://t.co/IJRwMMv85q

The ruling class of this country is absolutely terrified that we just might show the working class what it looks like when the United States government delivers for someone who is not a billionaire or a corporation.

In Washington, Republicans don't think twice about huge tax cuts for billionaires. But when you start talking about doing anything at all to make life easier for working people? Forget it.

Republicans love socialism for the rich, rugged individualism for the rest of us.
The richest country in the world can afford to invest in the needs of working people.

Am I worried about the wishes of the more than 600 billionaires in America today? No, not for a minute.

I am worried about a working class who has been neglected by their government for decades, who is working longer hours for less pay. That's who I'm worried about.

The establishment incumbent that @Indiawaltonbflo defeated in the primary is running a write-in campaign backed by corporate interests and Republicans. She's going to need your help to get over the finish line.

Chip in whatever you can afford: https://t.co/xBBI2ta3OG

"This is about working class folks finally stepping up and saying, 'enough is enough.' We're ready to reclaim our seat of power and make sure we do what's right for the many."

@Indiawaltonbflo is running a bold campaign to be mayor of Buffalo, NY — and she's going to win. https://t.co/hXxXz9786d

How can anyone say they are "patriotic" and "love their country" when they refuse to act against the drought, flooding, forest fires and extreme weather disturbances which cause our nation so much destruction. Climate change is real. The U.S. must lead the way in combating it.
Please get vaccinated.

It is the working class of America that makes this country move.

Not Wall Street stockbrokers.
Not real estate speculators.
Not hedge fund managers.
Not billionaires.
Not CEOs taking exorbitant compensation packages while cutting the benefits of workers.

Workers have the power.

In Congress, we have a very simple choice to make.

Do we listen to 1,500 pharmaceutical industry lobbyists telling us to let them continue to rip off the American people, or do we listen to tens of millions of Americans who tell us we should lower drug prices in this country?

It is obscene that no member of the Sackler family, which profited for years from the sale of OxyContin and at the expense of the suffering of millions, has faced criminal charges for their actions. https://t.co/SmrnaWgjPd

NEWSFLASH: The overwhelming majority of the American people are with us. They want us to lower prescription drug costs. They want the wealthy to pay their fair share. We cannot let Big Pharma's lobbyists and the millions of dollars of dishonest ads from the ruling class stop us. https://t.co/jyiyRGX8Ev

When poll after poll tells us that the American people overwhelmingly support our efforts to dramatically lower the cost of prescription drugs in this country, what should we do?

Easy answer: we summon the courage in the Congress to stand up to Big Pharma and end their greed.
